alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 5:59PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Intrenchment Creek at Constitution Rd near Atlanta affecting DeKalb County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Intrenchment Creek at Constitution Rd near Atlanta. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding will occur in the woodlands and natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Constitution Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:46 PM EDT Monday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:46 PM EDT Monday was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 09/17/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
